context: 3.2 g of dry solid media were confined in wire-mesh boxes made of stainless steel 316 (dimension 10 × 2.5 × 0.5 cm) located in the center of the bioreactor (Fig. 2 ). Vermiculite exhibited a particle size distribution between 4.8 and 3.4 mm, with a water retention capacity of 68(±5) %, initial pH of 4.29(±1.1) and a bed porosity of 60(±5) %. In order to validate the assumption of negligible n-pentane adsorption on vermiculite (assumption 3 in the Mathematical Model section), an n-pentane adsorption isotherm was experimentally determined by contacting a known mass of vermiculite with gas with a known n-pentane concentration in a tight gas container for a period of 24 h, enough to reach equilibrium at 30 °C. The amount of n-pentane adsorbed was calculated as the difference between initial and final n-pentane concentration (measured by gas chromatography, see section Analytical Methods).Experimental fungal bioreactor description Experiments were performed in three 1-L glass gas-tight bioreactors containing 100 mL of sterile distilled water at the bottom, for moisture control. The wire-mesh boxes containing the solid support were suspended (Fig. 2) inside each reactor. The temperature of the experimental set-up was maintained at 30(±3)°C using a thermoregulated chamber.
